metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2377 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the handling of the MXIT protocol in Pidgin. Specially crafted MXIT data sent by the server could potentially result in an out-of-bounds write of one byte. A malicious server can send a negative content-length in response to a HTTP request triggering the vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2377` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

finch - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
libpurple-bin - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
libpurple0 - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
pidgin - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
pidgin-data - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pidgin package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3').
